blocks.name: ax-reg
blocks.content: Axiom of Regularity. An axiom of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. Also called the Axiom of Foundation. A rather non-intuitive axiom that denies more than it asserts, it states (in the form of ~ zfreg ) that every nonempty set contains a set disjoint from itself. One consequence is that it denies the existence of a set containing itself ( ~ elirrv ). A stronger version that works for proper classes is proved as ~ zfregs . (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: axreg2
blocks.content: Axiom of Regularity expressed more compactly. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2003.)

blocks.name: zfregcl
blocks.content: The Axiom of Regularity with class variables. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1994.) Replace sethood hypothesis with sethood antecedent. (Revised by BJ, 27-Apr-2021.)

thm zfregcl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, c1, wi(wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c0))))), wi(wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c0)))))
  exbidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))
  rexeqbi1dv(s0, cv(hs0), c0, wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c0))))
  ralbidv(s1, cv(s0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c0)))
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s1))
  exlimi(s0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  nfre1(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))
  sylib(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))))
  axreg2(s0, hs0, s1)
  bitr2i(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))))
  rexbii(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  df-ral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  df-rex(s0, cv(hs0), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c0))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: zfreg
blocks.content: The Axiom of Regularity using abbreviations. Axiom 6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 21. This is called the "weak form". Axiom Reg of [BellMachover] p. 480. There is also a "strong form", not requiring that ` A ` be a set, that can be proved with more difficulty (see ~ zfregs ). (Contributed by NM, 26-Nov-1995.) Replace sethood hypothesis with sethood antecedent. (Revised by BJ, 27-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfreg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cin(cv(s0), c0), emptycls)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cin(cv(s0), c0), emptycls)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wrex(s0, c0, wral(hs0, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))))
  anim2i(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  biimpi(wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  n0(s0, c0)
  imp(wcel(c0, c1), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(hs0, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))))
  zfregcl(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  biimpri(wrex(s0, c0, wral(hs0, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cin(cv(s0), c0), emptycls)))
  rexbii(s0, c0, wceq(cin(cv(s0), c0), emptycls), wral(hs0, cv(s0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c0))))
  disj(hs0, cv(s0), c0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
}

blocks.name: elirrv
blocks.content: The membership relation is irreflexive: no set is a member of itself. Theorem 105 of [Suppes] p. 54. (This is trivial to prove from ~ zfregfr and ~ efrirr , but this proof is direct from the Axiom of Regularity.) (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1993.)
blocks.origin:

  snex(cv(s0))

  eleq1w(hs1, s0, csn(cv(s0)))

  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), csn(cv(s0))))
  eleq1w(hs0, s0, csn(cv(s0)))

blocks.name: elirr
blocks.content: No class is a member of itself. Exercise 6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 22. (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-1994.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 9-Jul-2011.)

blocks.name: elneq
blocks.content: A class is not equal to any of its elements. (Contributed by AV, 14-Jun-2022.)

blocks.name: nelaneq
blocks.content: A class is not an element of and equal to a class at the same time. Variant of ~ elneq analogously to ~ elnotel and ~ en2lp . (Proposed by BJ, 18-Jun-2022.) (Contributed by AV, 18-Jun-2022.)

blocks.name: epinid0
blocks.content: The membership (epsilon) relation and the identity relation are disjoint. Variable-free version of ~ nelaneq . (Proposed by BJ, 18-Jun-2022.) (Contributed by AV, 18-Jun-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  gen2(hs0, hs1, wn(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))

  opab0(hs0, hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}

blocks.name: sucprcreg
blocks.content: A class is equal to its successor iff it is a proper class (assuming the Axiom of Regularity). (Contributed by NM, 9-Jul-2004.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 16-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:

} = {

  imnani(wceq(csuc(c0), c0), wcel(c0, universe))

blocks.name: ruv

blocks.name: en2lp
blocks.content: No class has 2-cycle membership loops. Theorem 7X(b) of [Enderton] p. 206. (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-1996.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: opthreg
blocks.content: Theorem for alternate representation of ordered pairs, requiring the Axiom of Regularity ~ ax-reg (via the ~ preleq step). See ~ df-op for a description of other ordered pair representations. Exercise 34 of [Enderton] p. 207. (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-1996.) (Proof shortened by AV, 15-Jun-2022.)
